abstract: A mask that defines which categories of physics fields can exert forces on the particles.
overview:
## Discussion

When a particle is inside the region of a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode] object, that field node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/categoryBitMask] property is compared to the emitter’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKEmitterNode/fieldBitMask] property by performing a logical AND operation. If the result is a non-zero value, then the field node’s effect is applied to the particle as if it had a physics body. The physics body is assumed to have a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/mass] of `1.0` and a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/charge] of `1.0`

The default value is `0x00000000` (all bits cleared).

# fieldBitMask

**Instance Property**

A mask that defines which categories of physics fields can exert forces on the particles.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var fieldBitMask: UInt32 { get set }
```

```swift
var fieldBitMask: UInt32 { get set }
```

## Discussion

When a particle is inside the region of a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode] object, that field node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/categoryBitMask] property is compared to the emitter’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKEmitterNode/fieldBitMask] property by performing a logical AND operation. If the result is a non-zero value, then the field node’s effect is applied to the particle as if it had a physics body. The physics body is assumed to have a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/mass] of `1.0` and a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/charge] of `1.0`

The default value is `0x00000000` (all bits cleared).
title: fieldBitMask
